item.title: Best Black Friday PlayStation Deals 2025: PS5, Games & Accessories
item.content:encoded:
The 2025 holiday shopping season is here, and that means companies are looking to get last-minute purchases for the year by offering customers discounts on a number of products and accessories. This year, Sony is offering plenty of deals for Black Friday and throughout the holiday season on things like PlayStation 5 (PS5) consoles, controllers, games, and even PlayStation Plus memberships.

But what deals are there, and are they worth picking up? Check out the list of the best Black Friday PlayStation deals for 2025 below. And make sure to let us know what you might pick up down in the comments and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

When do the PlayStation Black Friday Deals Start?

If you want to take advantage of the sales being offered by PlayStation this year, the offers begin on November 21st. Most deals will then run through Black Friday up until December 1st. The PlayStation Plus membership deal goes until December 5th, while the accessories sales go to December 18th.

Best PlayStation Deals for Black Friday and the 2025 Holidays

PS5 Console Deals

There are two console bundle deals being offered by Sony this year. The first is the PS5 Digital Edition 825GB Fortnite Flowering Chaos bundle for $399.99, a savings of $100 from the standard digital console. The other console deal is another Fortnite bundle for the 1TB Physical Edition PS5 for $499.99. That’s also a savings of $100.

As far as the extras in the bundle, players will get eight exclusive cosmetics that are estimated at 5,000 V-Bucks and an extra 1,000 V-Bucks.

In addition to the bundles, players will also get $100 off PS5 systems, including the PS5 Pro, when the deals go live on November 21

PS5 Accessories

One of the bigger deals for the holidays comes in the form of PlayStation accessories. These deals include PS VR2, PlayStation Portal, DualSense Controllers, and more. You can check all of those discounts out below.

  • $100 USD off PlayStation VR2
  • $20 USD off PlayStation Portal remote player
  • $20 USD off Pulse Elite wireless headset
  • $30 USD off Pulse Explore wireless earbuds 
  • $30 USD off DualSense Edge wireless controller
  • $20 USD off DualSense wireless controller
  • $20 USD off Access controller

PlayStation Plus Memberships

For those who want to either sign up or upgrade their PlayStation Plus (PS Plus) membership, you can sign up for a 12-month PlayStation Plus Essential, Extra, or Premium subscription and get 33% off the price. That puts the sale prices at:

  • PS Plus Essential: ~$54 for 12 months, down from $79.99
  • PS Plus Extra: ~$90 for 12 months, down from $134.99
  • PS Plus Premium: ~$108 for 12 months, down from $159.99

If you already have a subscription and want to upgrade the rest of your time, you’ll also get 33% off on the cost for the remainder of the membership.

PS5 Game Deals

If you already have a console and you are looking for deals on new PS5 games, there will be “various discounts on PS5 games”. Details on specific deals will come just before or at the start of the sale. This article will be updated as soon as that’s announced, so bookmark this page to stay up to date.

Right now, however, Sony is advertising discounts of up to 75% on games for both PS5 and PS4 until December 1st.

NOTE: Insider Gaming may earn affiliate commission if you purchase items through links on Insider Gaming. Read more about affiliate commission here.

item.title: Ubisoft’s On-Hold Financial Report Will Be Published Before Friday
item.content:encoded:
Ubisoft has revealed that the H1 FY 2025-26 report that was recently put on hold will be published ‘before the opening of trading on Friday 21st November 2025’. This news comes mere days after Ubisoft delayed the release of the report and put a hold on trading, fuelling widespread speculation.

The leading belief was that Ubisoft was going to uncover something huge, such as an imminent buyout. That has not proven to be the case thus far, but at the very least, we’ll have fresh numbers to examine before Friday.

Ubisoft to Reveal Performance

In a report circulated by Insider Gaming last week, Ubisoft’s Chief Financial Officer explained why a hold had been put on trading:

I wanted to let you know that we are taking extra time to finalize the closing of the semester, and as a result we will publish our first-half earnings results in the coming days instead of tonight.

Due to legal regulations, we cannot share more information with you at this time. To limit unnecessary speculation and market volatility during this short delay, we have asked Euronext to suspend the trading of our stock until the results are announced. We know this is likely to raise questions and drive media coverage.

I encourage you all to listen to the conference call – which will be available via the Investor section of our site — just after the results are released so that you have a more detailed view of our earnings.

It has now been confirmed that the financial release will drop before trading opens on Friday, which means it’ll probably be published tomorrow. Despite trying to remain cool and prevent ‘unnecessary speculation’, Ubisoft sparked just that by this action, which has mostly gone unanswered.

In a recent filing, Ubisoft’s United Kingdom arm stressed that the face of the games industry is changing as people ‘play fewer games for longer’, which is causing standalone, single releases to ‘struggle to stand out’.

What are you expecting from Ubisoft’s financial update? Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Ghost of Yotei is getting NG+

item.title: God of War 2018 Has Allegedly Been Copied By A 2024 Indian Animated Movie
item.content:encoded:
If you thought a 7-year-old game couldn’t have one of its most iconic action scenes imitated by an animated Indian film, then think again. Accusations have suddenly come to light that Mahavatar Narashimha blatantly copies some of God of War 2018’s most iconic fight scenes.

Santa Monica’s 2018 reboot of God of War is a masterpiece. The combat is classic Kratos chaos, and its boss fights and action sequences go up a notch. Who can forget the opening sequence between Kratos and Baldur? Not Mahavatar Narashimha, apparently.

God of War And Mahavatar Narashimha Have Something In Common?

It wouldn’t be a shock if you’ve never heard of Mahavatar Narashimha. The Indian animated movie isn’t well-known outside the country of its origin. Even though it was first debuted at the International Film Festival of India in 2024, it only got a proper theatrical release this year.

It’s been a few months since its July 2025 debut on the silver screen. However, one narrative has suddenly come to the fore: One of Mahavatar Narashimha’s sequences looks like a direct copy of Kratos and Baldur’s first encounter.

X account Black Thunder has done a side-by-side video, showing the God of War sequence, and the alleged Mahavatar Narashimha imitation. The 19-second clip features Mahavatar Narashimha’s character being sent flying through the air—like Kratos—before crashing and lying face-first on the floor—like Kratos.

The next few seconds are unnervingly identical as each antagonist flies toward the character, misses, and stands up menacingly. Both heroes then rip a tree out of the ground, before being tackled and attacked in (again) frame-by-frame copies of one another.

You can be the judge on this one. It’s not like this would be the first time something has ever copied something else; it’s just odd. Do you think this is nothing more than a happy coincidence? Or is Mahavatar Narashimha blatantly honoring Santa Monica’s game? Give us your opinion via the Official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

IG has more news for you, including A New 400-Page Elden Ring Lore Book, and Ghost of Yotei’s New Game Plus Patch Getting A Release Date.

item.title: Yeet A Friend Codes (November 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Roblox Yeet A Friend monthly redeem codes for November 2025 to get your hands on plenty of free rewards, including Stars, Boosts, Spins, Gems and Pets. 

Yeet A Friend is a popular physics-based Roblox experience where players are given the rather exciting task of throwing (or rather yeeting) a friend as far away as possible. The main objective of the game is simply to launch your friend the maximum possible distance, with all the upgrades and abilities in the game centred around the same. 

Players have to gain strength and energy by clicking and performing other activities, as the strength meter resets with each throw. This means players have to regain strength after every throw, adding further replayability to this already enjoyable game. With multiple worlds to play in and a worldwide leaderboard for the best throws, Yeet A Friend is a game that players can spend hours on without getting bored. Although gaining strength and energy isn’t overly challenging, using some redeem codes can make it even more fun, because who doesn’t like a few free rewards? 

Active Yeet A Friend Codes

Expired Yeet A Friend Codes

  • JackoLantern
  • SuperRebirths
  • HALFMILLIONINSANITY
  • Sewer
  • Mask
  • PetIndex
  • NeonPet
  • Nightmares
  • Sunglasses
  • Halloween2023
  • YeetA250k
  • AtomicReward
  • Library
  • MoneyUpdate
  • Alien
  • Yarrr
  • Yeet
  • Release
  • Trading
  • Atlantis
  • OneThousandLikes

How To Redeem Yeet A Friend Codes

Redeeming codes in Yeet A Friend is a fairly simple process. All players need to do is navigate through the menus and input one of the active codes listed above into the corresponding text box. Here’s a step-by-step guide on how to go about doing that:

  1. Launch Roblox and open up Yeet A Friend.
  2. Stand on the ‘Reward’ platform on the right side of the map from spawn.
  3. Enter one of the active codes listed above into the text box that opens.
  4. Click on the ‘Redeem’ button to claim your rewards.

How To Get More Yeet A Friend Codes

Codes for Yeet A Friend are often released during events or updates, so the next code drop could be on the horizon. With this in mind, players are encouraged to keep this page bookmarked, as we update this article as soon as any new codes are released. This will save you the hassle of tracking both the game’s socials as well as the official Discord server, giving you the codes that you’re after, all in one place.

If you’re a fan of all things Roblox, you can also check out our code guides for other fishing-related games like Steal a Fish, Own a Fishpond, and Lost Currents.

Interested in the latest developments in the world of gaming and esports? Then join the Insider Gaming Discord server and engage with the passionate community.
